The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand: If the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand had not occurred, the outbreak of World War I would not have happened. This event would have prevented the deaths of millions of soldiers and civilians and would have had a profound impact on the course of history.

The signing of the Magna Carta: The signing of the Magna Carta in 1215 was a pivotal moment in history as it established the principle of rule of law. If this event had not occurred, the rights and freedoms we enjoy today may not have been established.

The invention of the printing press: The invention of the printing press in the 15th century revolutionized the way information was disseminated and made it possible for knowledge to be widely shared. If this event had not occurred, the spread of ideas and information would have been much slower and more limited.

The discovery of penicillin: The discovery of penicillin in 1928 by Alexander Fleming was a major breakthrough in medicine. If this event had not occurred, the treatment of bacterial infections would have been much more difficult and many lives would have been lost.

The invention of the telephone: The invention of the telephone in the late 19th century revolutionized communication and made it possible for people to connect with each other instantly. If this event had not occurred, the way we communicate and conduct business would be vastly different today.
